title: Rosh HaAyin
text:
Rosh HaAyin (, ) is a <a href="List%20of%20Israeli%20cities">city</a> in the <a href="Central%20District%20%28Israel%29">Central District</a> of Israel. To the west of Rosh HaAyin is the fortress of <a href="Antipatris">Antipatris</a> and the source of the <a href="Yarkon%20River">Yarkon River</a>. To the southeast is the fortress of <a href="Migdal%20Afek">Migdal Afek</a> (Migdal Tzedek). In , it had a population of .
History.
Rosh HaAyin was founded in the 1949 near the site of ancient <a href="Antipatris">Antipatris</a> and on the land of the depopulated <a href="Palestinians">Palestinian</a> village of <a href="Majdal%20Yaba">Majdal Yaba</a>; about 1km north of the village site. Many of the early residents were religious <a href="Yemenite%20Jews">Yemenite Jews</a> airlifted to Israel in 1949 and 1950 in <a href="Operation%20Magic%20Carpet%20%28Yemen%29">Operation Magic Carpet</a>. They added Biblical words from Exodus 19:4 to the city's logo: "I (God) carried You on eagles' wings." The place was one of the Israel <a href="Ma%27abarot">Ma'abarot</a> (transit camps) in the 1950s.
In the 1990s, new neighborhoods were built, although the town still has a large Yemeni-Jewish population.
Rosh HaAyin is named after its location at the source of the Yarkon River ("rosh" = head, "ayin" = fountain, spring).
Archaeology.
In 2015, archaeologists discovered a large ancient <a href="farmhouse">farmhouse</a>. Among the other artifacts that were exposed in the farmhouse there were two silver coins from the fourth century BCE that bear the goddess <a href="Athena">Athena</a> and the <a href="Owl%20of%20Athena">Owl of Athena</a>. In addition, a monastery dating to the <a href="Byzantine%20period">Byzantine period</a> was discovered on one of the hills in the area and included a <a href="Eastern%20Orthodox%20Church">church</a>, an <a href="oil%20press">oil press</a>, residential quarters, and stables equipped with <a href="manger">manger</a>s and troughs, etc. In the church were colorful <a href="mosaic">mosaic</a>s and also numerous <a href="Greek%20inscriptions">Greek inscriptions</a>.
Demographics.
According to the <a href="Israel%20Central%20Bureau%20of%20Statistics">Israel Central Bureau of Statistics</a> (CBS), in 2018, the ethnic make-up of the city was 97.9% <a href="Jew">Jew</a>ish, with a predominant number of young people below the age of 19. The population growth rate was 9.7% at the end of 2019.
Economy.
According to the CBS, there were 10,972 salaried workers and 1,033 self-employed in 2000. The mean monthly wage for a salaried worker was <a href="Israeli%20new%20shekel">NIS</a> 6,595, an increase of 11.2% over the course of 2000. Salaried males had a mean monthly wage of NIS 8,408 (a real change of 7.8%) versus NIS 4,857 for females (a real change of 13.1%). The mean income for the self-employed was 6,853. 628 people received unemployment benefits, and 1,057 received an income supplement.
In 2004, the Givot Olam oil company discovered oil at the <a href="Meged%20oil%20field">Meged 5 oil field</a> near Rosh HaAyin. It is one of the largest on-shore oil fields in Israel. It began production in 2010, and produces <a href="oil">oil</a> as well as some <a href="natural%20gas">natural gas</a>. Its proven oil reserves are about .
<a href="TTI%20Telecom">TTI Telecom</a> is located in Rosh HaAyin.
Education.
According to the CBS, there are 24 schools in Rosh Ha'ayin, with an enrollment of 8,288. Eighteen were elementary schools, with an enrollment of 5,043, and high schools, have an enrollment of 3,245. In 2001, 58.8% of Rosh Ha'ayin's 12th grade students were entitled to a <a href="matriculation">matriculation</a> certificate.
Sports.
S.C Rosh Ha'ayin ("Moadon Sport Rosh Ha'ayin"), a football team who plays at "Liga Gimel Sharon".
<a href="Rosh%20HaAyin%20%28beach%20soccer%29">Ironi Rosh HaAyin</a> is a professional beach soccer team based in Rosh HaAyin, Israel.
